headline.main: Personal Health; For some overeaters, group support is the only way to stop their compulsive behavior.

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody article on compulsive overeating; discusses Overeaters Anonymous, organization that holds meetings for overeaters (L)
docs.lead_paragraph: LAURA is a compulsive overeater. She is also a member of Overeaters Anonymous, a group fashioned along the lines of Al coholics Anonymous to help sufferers overcome a life-disrupting addiction to food that can lead to severe obesity and profound unhappiness.

headline.main: Struggling With Obesity: A Personal Journal; Worried Over a Talk on Obesity Abundant Size at Odds With Beauty Loss of 38 Pounds in Three Years Easier for Those Who Work

docs.abstract: Article on journal and tape-recording kept by Dr Angela Barron McBride of her thoughts as she attempted to lose weight (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Last August, Angela Barron McBride decided that keeping a journal and tape-recording her thoughts as she commuted to work would not only help her lose weight but would also probe her deepest feelings about excess weight.
docs.snippet: Last August, Angela Barron McBride decided that keeping a journal and tape-recording her thoughts as she commuted to work would not only help her lose weight but would also probe her deepest feelings about excess weight.
